item.title: Coronavirus: Portugal added to UK's safe travel list as Croatia is removed
item.description: Portugal is added to UK's safe travel list but Croatia, Austria and Trinidad and Tobago are removed.

item.title: Pupils get record GCSE grades as BTecs are pulled
item.description: Thousands get their results after a disrupted academic year, but BTec students face further delay.

item.title: 'A weight has been lifted off my shoulders'
item.description: Many students are relieved about their results after a U-turn over how they were calculated.

item.title: Steve Bannon charged with fraud over Mexico wall funds
item.description: Ex-Trump adviser Steve Bannon is charged with fraud over fundraising to build a Mexican border wall.

item.title: Manchester Arena attack: Hashem Abedi jailed for minimum 55 years
item.description: Hashem Abedi is sentenced for the murders of 22 people in the Manchester Arena suicide bombing.

item.title: Coronavirus: Quarantine lifted for Portugal travel, and a back garden beauty salon
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus outbreak this Thursday evening.

item.title: Students to be offered first choice university places
item.description: The government is also lifting student number caps for would be doctors, dentists, vets and teachers.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: 'Poisoned' Russian opposition leader in a coma
item.description: Alexei Navalny is seriously ill in a Siberian hospital - doctors say they are trying to save his life.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singing 'no more risky than talking'
item.description: It does not produce many more respiratory particles than speaking at similar volume, a study finds.

item.title: Tesco blackmail plot: Nigel Wright contaminated baby food
item.description: Nigel Wright put metal shards in baby food in an attempt to extort Â£1.4m from the supermarket.

item.title: Lyft suspends service in California over employment row
item.description: Both Uber and Lyft face a Friday deadline to change business practices in California.

item.title: AirBnB bans all house parties worldwide
item.description: The home-sharing firm threatens legal action against guests or hosts who violate the ban.

item.title: Dounreay site available for reuse in the year 2333
item.description: The Nuclear Decommissioning Authority says the Dounreay facility will be ready for redevelopment by 2333.

item.title: Coronavirus: 'My dad built me a beauty salon in the garden'
item.description: Some parents have gone to great lengths in order to help their children start a career in a pandemic.

item.title: 'Mummified' plants give glimpse of Earth's future
item.description: Fossilised leaves suggest some plants may adapt to grow more quickly as CO2 levels rise.

item.title: Linda Nolan: 'We are the chemo sisters'
item.description: The singer is undergoing treatment for liver cancer, alongside her sister Anne, who has breast cancer.

item.title: Chicken rehoming charity gets 52,000 lockdown hen requests
item.description: A shortage of eggs in shops early in lockdown sparked thousands of requests for birds across the UK.

item.title: Mukbang: Why is China clamping down on eating influencers?
item.description: The Chinese government is waging war on the eating influencers.

item.title: Jessie and Austin: The Bodies in the Suitcase
item.description: TikTok: Viral video of murder victims stays up, despite the familyâs request.

item.title: Coronavirus: Adventure days for NHS staff and families
item.description: The key workers are given a chance to escape the stress of Covid-19 by an outdoor centre.

item.title: Meet the UK's youngest qualified pilot, aged 14
item.description: Jack Jenner-Hall has qualified as a pilot at the age of 14 after flying a glider alone.

item.title: Former swimmer Harry Needs on coming out as bisexual
item.description: Former swimmer Harry Needs says bisexuality isn't "a gateway to becoming gay" or "greedy".

item.title: The king, his lover - and the elephant in the palace
item.description: Corinna zu Sayn-Wittgenstein speaks out about a multi-million euro gift from Spain's ex-king and an ill-fated elephant hunt.

item.title: Coronavirus: How has the pandemic changed politicians' holidays?
item.description: Can our leaders still enjoy a relaxing break in the middle of a global pandemic?

item.title: 'We have had parents crying for us to open'
item.description: The children's activities sector says it has been hit hard by the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: Migrant crossings: What happens to migrants who reach the UK?
item.description: The government wants to cut the number of migrants crossing the Channel.

item.title: US Election 2020: Kamala Harris targeted by false conspiracy theories
item.description: The Democratic vice-presidential nominee has been subjected to lots of false claims on social media.

item.title: Anthony Horowitz: 'I feel the need to do the unexpected'
item.description: The prolific novelist's latest work is a mind-bending murder mystery to tie readers in knots.

item.title: Arctic National Wildlife Refuge: The animals at risk from Alaska oil drilling
item.description: As Donald Trump pushes forward with plans for drilling in the Alaskan wilderness, what is at stake?

item.title: Premier League fixtures released - Liverpool host Leeds on opening weekend
item.description: Champions Liverpool will face promoted Leeds in the standout game of the 2020-21 Premier League season's opening weekend.

item.title: Flexible start times agreed for England v Pakistan third Test
item.description: Flexible start times for England's third Test against Pakistan have been agreed after the second Test was ruined by rain and bad light.

item.title: Will GCSE grade inflation cause problems for future students? And other questions
item.description: Are you concerned about your GCSE results? Experts answer some of your questions.

item.title: 10 charts on what happens after GCSEs
item.description: At 16, teenagers face a number of training or education choices - but how have these decisions changed over time?

item.title: How the GCSE grading system works
item.description: As teenagers receive their GCSE results, BBC News explains the 9-1 grading structure in England.

item.title: Is exam chaos costing the Tories support?
item.description: Alex Forsyth tests the mood in a former Labour heartland after a rocky week for the government.

item.title: BTec Nationals and Firsts: What went wrong with the grades?
item.description: The BTec First grades have been delayed. What caused the problems with the results?

item.title: What's different with this year's GCSEs
item.description: With the last-minute change in the way GCSE results are calculated, how will results day look this year?

item.title: Why were exam results changed?
item.description: The government has made a U-turn on A-level results in England, but what sparked such controversy?
